ENOBARBUS
SSENGER. The nature of bad news infects the teller.
  ANTONY. 
3

ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. When it concerns the fool or coward. On!
  MESSENGER.

  ANTONY.

  MESSENGER.

  ANTONY.

ENOBARBUS
TONY. From Sicyon, ho, the news! Speak there!
  FIRST 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
RST ATTENDANT. The man from Sicyon- is there such an one?
  SECOND 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
COND ATTENDANT. He stays upon your will.
  ANTONY. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. Let him appear.
  ANTONY. 
4
CHARMIAN
MESSENGER
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. Let him appear.
    These strong Egyptian fetters I must break,
    Or lose myself in dotage.
  SECOND 
4
CHARMIAN
MESSENGER
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
COND MESSENGER. Fulvia thy wife is dead.
  ANTONY. 
4
CHARMIAN
MESSENGER
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. Where died she?
  SECOND 
4
CHARMIAN
MESSENGER
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
COND MESSENGER. In Sicyon.
  ANTONY. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. Forbear me.                             Exit MESSENGER
  ANTONY. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. Forbear me.                             Exit MESSENGER
    There's a great spirit gone! Thus did I desire it.
    What our contempts doth often hurl from us
    We wish it ours again; the present pleasure,
    By revolution low'ring, does become
    The opposite of itself. She's good, being gone;
    The hand could pluck her back that shov'd her on.
    I must from this enchanting queen break off.
    Ten thousand harms, more than the ills I know,
    My idleness doth hatch. How now, Enobarbus!
  ENOBARBUS. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
OBARBUS. What's your pleasure, sir?
  ANTONY. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. I must with haste from hence.
  ENOBARBUS. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
OBARBUS. Why, then we kill all our women. We see how mortal an
  ANTONY. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. I must be gone.
  ENOBARBUS. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
OBARBUS. Under a compelling occasion, let women die. It were pity
  ANTONY. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. She is cunning past man's thought.
  ENOBARBUS.

ANTONY
ENOBARBUS

  ANTONY.

1
CLEOPATRA
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
CLEOPATRA
EOPATRA. Where is he?
  CHARMIAN. 
1
CLEOPATRA
ARMIAN. I did not see him since.
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
CLEOPATRA
EOPATRA. See where he is, who's with him, what he does.
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
CLEOPATRA
EOPATRA. See where he is, who's with him, what he does.
    I did not send you. If you find him sad,
    Say I am dancing; if in mirth, report
    That I am sudden sick. Quick, and return.        Exit ALEXAS
  CHARMIAN. 
1
CLEOPATRA
ARMIAN. Madam, methinks, if you did love him dearly,
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
CLEOPATRA
EOPATRA. What should I do I do not?
  CHARMIAN. 
1
CLEOPATRA
ARMIAN. In each thing give him way; cross him in nothing.
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
CLEOPATRA
EOPATRA. Thou teachest like a fool- the way to lose him.
  CHARMIAN. 
1
CLEOPATRA
ARMIAN. Tempt him not so too far; I wish, forbear;
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
ARMIAN. Tempt him not so too far; I wish, forbear;
    In time we hate that which we often fear.
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. I am sick and sullen.
  ANTONY. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
TONY. I am sorry to give breathing to my purpose-
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Help me away, dear Charmian; I shall fall.
  ANTONY. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
TONY. Now, my dearest queen-
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Pray you, stand farther from me.
  ANTONY. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
TONY. What's the matter?
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. I know by that same eye there's some good news.
  ANTONY. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
TONY. The gods best know-
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. O, never was there queen
  ANTONY.

TONY. Cleopatra-
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Why should I think you can be mine and true,
  ANTONY. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
TONY. Most sweet queen-
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Nay, pray you seek no colour for your going,
  ANTONY.

ANTONY
TONY. How now, lady!
  CLEOPATRA.

  ANTONY.

  CLEOPATRA.

  ANTONY.

EOPATRA. O most false love!
  ANTONY. 
2
CLEOPATRA

TONY. Quarrel no more, but be prepar'd to know
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Cut my lace, Charmian, come!
  ANTONY. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
TONY. My precious queen, forbear,
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. So Fulvia told me.
  ANTONY. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
TONY. You'll heat my blood; no more.
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. You can do better yet; but this is meetly.
  ANTONY. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
TONY. Now, by my sword-
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ANTONY
EOPATRA. And target. Still he mends;
  ANTONY.

  CLEOPATRA.

1
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
  CAESAR. 
1
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
ESAR. You may see, Lepidus, and henceforth know,
  LEPIDUS. 
1
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
PIDUS. I must not think there are
  CAESAR. 
1
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
ESAR. You are too indulgent. Let's grant it is not
  CAESAR. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
ESAR. You are too indulgent. Let's grant it is not
    Amiss to tumble on the bed of Ptolemy,
    To give a kingdom for a mirth, to sit
    And keep the turn of tippling with a slave,
    To reel the streets at noon, and stand the buffet
    With knaves that smell of sweat. Say this becomes him-
    As his composure must be rare indeed
    Whom these things cannot blemish- yet must Antony
    No way excuse his foils when we do bear
    So great weight in his lightness. If he fill'd
    His vacancy with his voluptuousness,
    Full surfeits and the dryness of his bones
    Call on him for't! But to confound such time
    That drums him from his sport and speaks as loud
    As his own state and ours- 'tis to be chid
    As we rate boys who, being mature in knowledge,
    Pawn their experience to their present pleasure,
    And so rebel to judgment.
  LEPIDUS. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
PIDUS. Here's more news.
  MESSENGER. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Thy biddings have been done; and every hour,
  CAESAR. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
ESAR. I should have known no less.
  MESSENGER. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Caesar, I bring thee word
  CAESAR. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
ESAR. Antony,
  LEPIDUS. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
PIDUS. 'Tis pity of him.
  CAESAR. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
ESAR. Let his shames quickly
  LEPIDUS. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
PIDUS. To-morrow, Caesar,
  CAESAR. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
ESAR. Till which encounter
  LEPIDUS. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
PIDUS. Farewell, my lord. What you shall know meantime
  CAESAR. 
2
OCTAVIUS CAESAR
MESSENGER
ESAR. Doubt not, sir;
  CAESAR.

1
CLEOPATRA

  CLEOPATRA. 
1

  MARDIAN. 
1

  CLEOPATRA. 
1
CLEOPATRA
EOPATRA. Indeed?
  MARDIAN. 
1
CLEOPATRA
RDIAN. Not in deed, madam; for I can do nothing
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
CLEOPATRA
EOPATRA. O Charmian,
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EOPATRA. O Charmian,
    Where think'st thou he is now? Stands he or sits he?
    Or does he walk? or is he on his horse?
    O happy horse, to bear the weight of Antony!
    Do bravely, horse; for wot'st thou whom thou mov'st?
    The demi-Atlas of this earth, the arm
    And burgonet of men. He's speaking now,
    Or murmuring 'Where's my serpent of old Nile?'
    For so he calls me. Now I feed myself
    With most delicious poison. Think on me,
    That am with Phoebus' amorous pinches black,
    And wrinkled deep in time? Broad-fronted Caesar,
    When thou wast here above the ground, I was
    A morsel for a monarch; and great Pompey
    Would stand and make his eyes grow in my brow;
    There would he anchor his aspect and die
    With looking on his life.
  ALEXAS. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EXAS. Sovereign of Egypt, hail!
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EOPATRA. How much unlike art thou Mark Antony!
  ALEXAS. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EXAS. Last thing he did, dear Queen,
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EOPATRA. Mine ear must pluck it thence.
  ALEXAS. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EXAS. 'Good friend,' quoth he
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EOPATRA. What, was he sad or merry?
  ALEXAS. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EXAS. Like to the time o' th' year between the extremes
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EOPATRA. O well-divided disposition! Note him,
  ALEXAS. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EXAS. Ay, madam, twenty several messengers.
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EOPATRA. Who's born that day
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
ARMIAN. O that brave Caesar!
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EOPATRA. Be chok'd with such another emphasis!
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
ARMIAN. The valiant Caesar!
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EOPATRA. By Isis, I will give thee bloody teeth
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
ARMIAN. By your most gracious pardon,
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
ALEXAS
EOPATRA. My salad days,
  CLEOPATRA.

1
POMPEY
MPEY. Where have you this? 'Tis false.
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. From Silvius, sir.
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. He dreams. I know they are in Rome together,
  POMPEY. 
2
POMPEY
VARRIUS
MPEY. He dreams. I know they are in Rome together,
    Looking for Antony. But all the charms of love,
    Salt Cleopatra, soften thy wan'd lip!
    Let witchcraft join with beauty, lust with both;
    Tie up the libertine in a field of feasts,
    Keep his brain fuming. Epicurean cooks
    Sharpen with cloyless sauce his appetite,
    That sleep and feeding may prorogue his honour
    Even till a Lethe'd dullness-
  VARRIUS. 
2
POMPEY
VARRIUS
RRIUS. This is most certain that I shall deliver:
  POMPEY. 
2
POMPEY
VARRIUS
MPEY. I could have given less matter
  MENAS. 
2
POMPEY
VARRIUS
NAS. I cannot hope
  POMPEY. 
2
POMPEY
VARRIUS
MPEY. I know not, Menas,
  POMPEY.

2

ANTONY

  ANTONY. 
1
ANTONY
TONY. Get thee gone.
    Say to Ventidius I would speak with him.
                                                 Exit SOOTHSAYER
  ANTONY. 
2
ANTONY
VENTIDIUS
TONY. Get thee gone.
    Say to Ventidius I would speak with him.
                                                 Exit SOOTHSAYER
    He shall to Parthia.- Be it art or hap,
    He hath spoken true. The very dice obey him;
    And in our sports my better cunning faints
    Under his chance. If we draw lots, he speeds;
    His cocks do win the battle still of mine,
    When it is all to nought, and his quails ever
    Beat mine, inhoop'd, at odds. I will to Egypt;
    And though I make this marriage for my peace,
    I' th' East my pleasure lies.
  ANTONY. 
1
LEPIDUS
  LEPIDUS. 
1
LEPIDUS
PIDUS. Trouble yourselves no further. Pray you hasten
  AGRIPPA. 
1
LEPIDUS
RIPPA. Sir, Mark Antony

1

PIDUS. Till I shall see you in your soldier's dress,
  MAECENAS.

ECENAS. We shall,
  LEPIDUS.

LEPIDUS
PIDUS. Your way is shorter;
  BOTH.

TH. Sir, good success!
  LEPIDUS.

PIDUS. Farewell.                                      Exeunt

  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. That time? O times
    I laughed him out of patience; and that night
    I laugh'd him into patience; and next morn,
    Ere the ninth hour, I drunk him to his bed,
    Then put my tires and mantles on him, whilst
    I wore his sword Philippan.
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Madam, madam-
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. Antony's dead! If thou say so, villain,
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. First, madam, he is well.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. Why, there's more gold.
  MESSENGER.

CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER

3

  MESSENGER.

3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. Th'art an honest man.
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Caesar and he are greater friends than ever.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. Make thee a fortune from me.
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. But yet, madam-
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. I do not like 'but yet.' It does allay
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Free, madam! No; I made no such report.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. For what good turn?
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. For the best turn i' th' bed.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. I am pale, Charmian.
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Madam, he's married to Octavia.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. The most infectious pestilence upon thee!
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Good madam, patience.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. What say you? Hence,                  [Strikes him]
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Gracious madam,
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. Say 'tis not so, a province I will give thee,
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. He's married, madam.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. Rogue, thou hast liv'd too long.    [Draws a knife]
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Nay, then I'll run.
  CHARMIAN. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
ARMIAN. Good madam, keep yourself within yourself:
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. Some innocents scape not the thunderbolt.
  CHARMIAN. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
ARMIAN. He is afear'd to come.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. I will not hurt him.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. I will not hurt him.
    These hands do lack nobility, that they strike
    A meaner than myself; since I myself
    Have given myself the cause.
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. I have done my duty.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. Is he married?
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. He's married, madam.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. The gods confound thee! Dost thou hold there still?
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Should I lie, madam?
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. O, I would thou didst,
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. I crave your Highness' pardon.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. He is married?
  MESSENGER. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
SSENGER. Take no offence that I would not offend you;
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
MESSENGER
EOPATRA. O, that his fault should make a knave of thee
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
EOPATRA. O, that his fault should make a knave of thee
    That art not what th'art sure of! Get thee hence.
    The merchandise which thou hast brought from Rome
    Are all too dear for me. Lie they upon thy hand,
    And be undone by 'em!                         Exit MESSENGER
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
ARMIAN. Good your Highness, patience.
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
EOPATRA. In praising Antony I have disprais'd Caesar.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
ARMIAN. Many times, madam.
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
EOPATRA. I am paid for't now. Lead me from hence,
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
CLEOPATRA
MARDIAN
EOPATRA. I am paid for't now. Lead me from hence,
    I faint. O Iras, Charmian! 'Tis no matter.
    Go to the fellow, good Alexas; bid him
    Report the feature of Octavia, her years,
    Her inclination; let him not leave out
    The colour of her hair. Bring me word quickly.
                                                     Exit ALEXAS
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
POMPEY
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. Your hostages I have, so have you mine;
  CAESAR. 
1
POMPEY
ESAR. Most meet
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. To you all three,
  CAESAR. 
1
POMPEY
ESAR. Take your time.
  ANTONY. 
1
POMPEY
TONY. Thou canst not fear us, Pompey, with thy sails;
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. At land, indeed,
  LEPIDUS. 
1
POMPEY
PIDUS. Be pleas'd to tell us-
  CAESAR. 
1
POMPEY
ESAR. There's the point.
  ANTONY. 
1
POMPEY
TONY. Which do not be entreated to, but weigh
  CAESAR. 
1
POMPEY
ESAR. And what may follow,
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. You have made me offer
  ALL. 
1
POMPEY
L. That's our offer.
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. Know, then,
  ANTONY. 
1
POMPEY
TONY. I have heard it, Pompey,
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. Let me have your hand.
  ANTONY. 
1
POMPEY
TONY. The beds i' th' East are soft; and thanks to you,
  CAESAR. 
1
POMPEY
ESAR. Since I saw you last
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. Well, I know not
  LEPIDUS. 
1
POMPEY
PIDUS. Well met here.
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. I hope so, Lepidus. Thus we are agreed.
  CAESAR. 
1
POMPEY
ESAR. That's the next to do.
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. We'll feast each other ere we part, and let's
  ANTONY. 
1
POMPEY
TONY. That will I, Pompey.
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. No, Antony, take the lot;
  ANTONY. 
1
POMPEY
TONY. You have heard much.
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. I have fair meanings, sir.
  ANTONY. 
1
POMPEY
TONY. And fair words to them.
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. Then so much have I heard;
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. No more of that! He did so.
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. What, I pray you?
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. A certain queen to Caesar in a mattress.
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. I know thee now. How far'st thou, soldier?
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. Well;
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. Let me shake thy hand.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. Sir,
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. Enjoy thy plainness;
  ALL. 
1
POMPEY
L. Show's the way, sir.
  POMPEY. 
1
POMPEY
MPEY. Come.               Exeunt all but ENOBARBUS and MENAS
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. [Aside] Thy father, Pompey, would ne'er have made this
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. At sea, I think.
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. We have, sir.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. You have done well by water.
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. And you by land.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. I Will praise any man that will praise me; though it
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. Nor what I have done by water.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. Yes, something you can deny for your own safety: you
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. And you by land.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. There I deny my land service. But give me your hand,
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. All men's faces are true, whatsome'er their hands are.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. But there is never a fair woman has a true face.
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. No slander: they steal hearts.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. We came hither to fight with you.
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. For my part, I am sorry it is turn'd to a drinking.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. If he do, sure he cannot weep't back again.
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. Y'have said, sir. We look'd not for Mark Antony here. Pray
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. Caesar' sister is call'd Octavia.
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. True, sir; she was the wife of Caius Marcellus.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. But she is now the wife of Marcus Antonius.
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. Pray ye, sir?
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. 'Tis true.
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. Then is Caesar and he for ever knit together.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. If I were bound to divine of this unity, I would not
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. I think the policy of that purpose made more in the marriage
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. I think so too. But you shall find the band that seems
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. Who would not have his wife so?
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. Not he that himself is not so; which is Mark Antony. He
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. And thus it may be. Come, sir, will you aboard? I have a
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
POMPEY
OBARBUS. I shall take it, sir. We have us'd our throats in Egypt.
  MENAS. 
1
POMPEY
NAS. Come, let's away.                                Exeunt
  MENAS.

  SECOND

  FIRST

POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
RST SERVANT. To be call'd into a huge sphere, and not to be seen
    to move in't, are the holes where eyes should be, which pitifully
    disaster the cheeks.

  LEPIDUS.

  ENOBARBUS.

CAESAR

                     ACT III. SCENE I.
                     A plain in Syria
  VENTIDIUS. 
4
POMPEY

SERVANTS

  SILIUS. 
4

CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
LIUS. Noble Ventidius,
  VENTIDIUS. 
4
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
NTIDIUS. O Silius, Silius,
  SILIUS. 
4
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
LIUS. Thou hast, Ventidius, that
  VENTIDIUS. 
4
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
NTIDIUS. I'll humbly signify what in his name,
  SILIUS. 
4
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
LIUS. Where is he now?
  VENTIDIUS. 
4
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
NTIDIUS. He purposeth to Athens; whither, with what haste
  VENTIDIUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
NTIDIUS. He purposeth to Athens; whither, with what haste
    The weight we must convey with's will permit,
    We shall appear before him.- On, there; pass along.
                                                          Exeunt
                            SCENE II. Rome. CAESAR'S house
  AGRIPPA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
RIPPA. What, are the brothers parted?
  ENOBARBUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
OBARBUS. They have dispatch'd with Pompey; he is gone;
  AGRIPPA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
RIPPA. 'Tis a noble Lepidus.
  ENOBARBUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
OBARBUS. A very fine one. O, how he loves Caesar!
  AGRIPPA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
RIPPA. Nay, but how dearly he adores Mark Antony!
  ENOBARBUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
OBARBUS. Caesar? Why he's the Jupiter of men.
  AGRIPPA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
RIPPA. What's Antony? The god of Jupiter.
  ENOBARBUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
OBARBUS. Spake you of Caesar? How! the nonpareil!
  AGRIPPA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
RIPPA. O, Antony! O thou Arabian bird!
  ENOBARBUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
OBARBUS. Would you praise Caesar, say 'Caesar'- go no further.
  AGRIPPA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
RIPPA. Indeed, he plied them both with excellent praises.
  ENOBARBUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
OBARBUS. But he loves Caesar best. Yet he loves Antony.
  AGRIPPA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
RIPPA. Both he loves.
  ENOBARBUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
OBARBUS. They are his shards, and he their beetle. [Trumpets
  AGRIPPA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
RIPPA. Good fortune, worthy soldier, and farewell.
  ANTONY. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
TONY. No further, sir.
  CAESAR. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
ESAR. You take from me a great part of myself;
  ANTONY. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
TONY. Make me not offended
  CAESAR. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
ESAR. I have said.
  ANTONY. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
TONY. You shall not find,
  CAESAR. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
ESAR. Farewell, my dearest sister, fare thee well.
  OCTAVIA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
TAVIA. My noble brother!
  ANTONY. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
TONY. The April's in her eyes. It is love's spring,
  OCTAVIA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
TAVIA. Sir, look well to my husband's house; and-
  CAESAR. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
ESAR. What, Octavia?
  OCTAVIA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
TAVIA. I'll tell you in your ear.
  ANTONY. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
TONY. Her tongue will not obey her heart, nor can
  ENOBARBUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
OBARBUS. [Aside to AGRIPPA] Will Caesar weep?
  AGRIPPA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
RIPPA. [Aside to ENOBARBUS] He has a cloud in's face.
  ENOBARBUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
OBARBUS. [Aside to AGRIPPA] He were the worse for that, were he a
  AGRIPPA. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
RIPPA. [Aside to ENOBARBUS] Why, Enobarbus,
  ENOBARBUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
OBARBUS. [Aside to AGRIPPA] That year, indeed, he was troubled
  CAESAR. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
ESAR. No, sweet Octavia,
  ANTONY. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
TONY. Come, sir, come;
  CAESAR. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
ESAR. Adieu; be happy!
  LEPIDUS. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
PIDUS. Let all the number of the stars give light
  CAESAR. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
ESAR. Farewell, farewell!                   [Kisses OCTAVIA]
  ANTONY. 
5
POMPEY
CAESAR
VENTIDIUS
SERVANTS
AGRIPPA
TONY. Farewell!                       Trumpets sound. Exeunt
  ANTONY. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS

                          SCENE III.
              Alexandria. CLEOPATRA'S palace
  CLEOPATRA. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. Where is the fellow?
  ALEXAS. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EXAS. Half afeard to come.
  CLEOPATRA. 
7

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. Go to, go to.
  ALEXAS. 
7

CLEOPATRA

  CLEOPATRA.

  MESSENGER.

  CLEOPATRA.

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS

  MESSENGER. 
7
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS

  CLEOPATRA.

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS

  MESSENGER. 
7

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
SSENGER. Madam, in Rome
  CLEOPATRA. 
7
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. Is she as tall as me?
  MESSENGER. 
7
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
SSENGER. She is not, madam.
  CLEOPATRA. 
7

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. Didst hear her speak? Is she shrill-tongu'd or low?
  MESSENGER. 
7
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
SSENGER. Madam, I heard her speak: she is low-voic'd.
  CLEOPATRA. 
7
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. That's not so good. He cannot like her long.
  CHARMIAN. 
7
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ARMIAN. Like her? O Isis! 'tis impossible.
  CLEOPATRA. 
7
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. I think so, Charmian. Dull of tongue and dwarfish!
  MESSENGER. 
7
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
SSENGER. She creeps.
  CLEOPATRA. 
7

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. Is this certain?
  MESSENGER. 
7

CLEOPATRA

MESSENGER
SERVANTS

  CHARMIAN. 
7

CLEOPATRA

SERVANTS

  CLEOPATRA.

  CHARMIAN.

  CLEOPATRA.

  CLEOPATRA.

  MESSENGER.

CLEOPATRA
POMPEY

MESSENGER
SERVANTS

  CLEOPATRA. 
7

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA

MESSENGER
SERVANTS

  MESSENGER.

SERVANTS

  CLEOPATRA.

CLEOPATRA

MESSENGER
SERVANTS

  MESSENGER.

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA

CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS

  CLEOPATRA. 
7

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. There's gold for thee.
  CLEOPATRA. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. There's gold for thee.
    Thou must not take my former sharpness ill.
    I will employ thee back again; I find thee
    Most fit for business. Go make thee ready;
    Our letters are prepar'd.                   Exeunt MESSENGER
  CHARMIAN. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ARMIAN. A proper man.
  CLEOPATRA. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. Indeed, he is so. I repent me much
  CHARMIAN. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ARMIAN. Nothing, madam.
  CLEOPATRA. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. The man hath seen some majesty, and should know.
  CHARMIAN. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ARMIAN. Hath he seen majesty? Isis else defend,
  CLEOPATRA. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EOPATRA. I have one thing more to ask him yet, good Charmian.
  CHARMIAN. 
6
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ARMIAN. I warrant you, madam.                         Exeunt
  CHARMIAN.

  OCTAVIA.

  ANTONY.

  OCTAVIA. 
7

CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR

TAVIA. Thanks to my lord.
  ANTONY. 
7
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
TONY. When it appears to you where this begins,
  ANTONY. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
TONY. When it appears to you where this begins,
    Turn your displeasure that way, for our faults
    Can never be so equal that your love
    Can equally move with them. Provide your going;
    Choose your own company, and command what cost
    Your heart has mind to.                               Exeunt
                           SCENE V.
                   Athens. ANTONY'S house
  ENOBARBUS. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. How now, friend Eros!
  EROS. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OS. There's strange news come, sir.
  ENOBARBUS. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. What, man?
  EROS. 
8

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OS. Caesar and Lepidus have made wars upon Pompey.
  ENOBARBUS. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. This is old. What is the success?
  EROS. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OS. Caesar, having made use of him in the wars 'gainst Pompey,
  ENOBARBUS. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY

  EROS. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OS. He's walking in the garden- thus, and spurns
  ENOBARBUS. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. Our great navy's rigg'd.
  EROS. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OS. For Italy and Caesar. More, Domitius:
  ENOBARBUS. 
8
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. 'Twill be naught;
  EROS. 
8

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS

CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OS. Come, sir.                                        Exeunt
  EROS.

CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS

CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY

  CAESAR.

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
ESAR. Most certain. Sister, welcome. Pray you
    Be ever known to patience. My dear'st sister!         Exeunt
                          SCENE VII.
                  ANTONY'S camp near Actium
  CLEOPATRA.

CAESAR

SERVANTS

AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY

  CLEOPATRA. 
9
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Is't not denounc'd against us? Why should not we
  ENOBARBUS. 
9
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. [Aside] Well, I could reply:
  CLEOPATRA. 
9
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
EOPATRA. What is't you say?
  ENOBARBUS. 
9
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. Your presence needs must puzzle Antony;
  CLEOPATRA. 
9
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Sink Rome, and their tongues rot
  CLEOPATRA. 
9
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Sink Rome, and their tongues rot
    That speak against us! A charge we bear i' th' war,
    And, as the president of my kingdom, will
    Appear there for a man. Speak not against it;
    I will not stay behind.
  ENOBARBUS. 
9
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. Nay, I have done.
  ANTONY. 
9
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
TONY. Is it not strange, Canidius,
  CLEOPATRA. 
9
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Celerity is never more admir'd
  ANTONY.

AGRIPPA

OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS

  CLEOPATRA.

OCTAVIA

  CANIDIUS.

  ENOBARBUS.

  ANTONY.

CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY

  CLEOPATRA.

CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS

OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY

  ANTONY. 
9
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
SERVANTS
ANTONY
TONY. Our overplus of shipping will we burn,
  ANTONY. 
10
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ANTONY
TONY. Our overplus of shipping will we burn,
    And, with the rest full-mann'd, from th' head of Actium
    Beat th' approaching Caesar. But if we fail,
    We then can do't at land.
  MESSENGER. 
10
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ANTONY
SSENGER. The news is true, my lord: he is descried;
  ANTONY. 
10
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ANTONY
TONY. Can he be there in person? 'Tis impossible-
  ANTONY. 
11
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ANTONY
TONY. Can he be there in person? 'Tis impossible-
    Strange that his power should be. Canidius,
    Our nineteen legions thou shalt hold by land,
    And our twelve thousand horse. We'll to our ship.
    Away, my Thetis!
  SOLDIER. 
11
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ANTONY
LDIER. O noble Emperor, do not fight by sea;
  ANTONY.

CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS

CAESAR
MESSENGER

  ANTONY.

CAESAR

                         Exeunt ANTONY, CLEOPATRA, and ENOBARBUS
  SOLDIER.

                          SCENE VIII.
                      A plain near Actium
  CAESAR.

SERVANTS
ESAR. Strike not by land; keep whole; provoke not battle
  CAESAR. 
11
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ANTONY
ESAR. Strike not by land; keep whole; provoke not battle
    Till we have done at sea. Do not exceed
    The prescript of this scroll. Our fortune lies
    Upon this jump.                                       Exeunt
                           SCENE IX.
                  Another part of the plain
  ANTONY. 
11
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ANTONY
TONY. Set we our squadrons on yon side o' th' hill,
  ANTONY. 
11
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ANTONY
TONY. Set we our squadrons on yon side o' th' hill,
    In eye of Caesar's battle; from which place
    We may the number of the ships behold,
    And so proceed accordingly.                           Exeunt
                           SCENE X.
                 Another part of the plain
        CANIDIUS marcheth with his land army one way
        over the stage, and TAURUS, the Lieutenant of
      CAESAR, the other way. After their going in is heard
                   the noise of a sea-fight
  ENOBARBUS. 
11
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. Naught, naught, all naught! I can behold no longer.
  ENOBARBUS. 
12
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
SERVANTS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. Naught, naught, all naught! I can behold no longer.
    Th' Antoniad, the Egyptian admiral,
    With all their sixty, fly and turn the rudder.
    To see't mine eyes are blasted.
  SCARUS. 
12
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS

OCTAVIA
CAESAR

SERVANTS
ANTONY With
ANTONY
OBARBUS. I'll yet follow
    The wounded chance of Antony, though my reason
    Sits in the wind against me.                          Exeunt
                         SCENE XI.
              Alexandria. CLEOPATRA'S palace
  ANTONY. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA

OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER

ANTONY
TONY. Hark! the land bids me tread no more upon't;
  ALL. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
ANTONY
L. Fly? Not we!
  ANTONY. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
ANTONY
TONY. I have fled myself, and have instructed cowards
  ANTONY. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
ANTONY
TONY. I have fled myself, and have instructed cowards
    To run and show their shoulders. Friends, be gone;
    I have myself resolv'd upon a course
    Which has no need of you; be gone.
    My treasure's in the harbour, take it. O,
    I follow'd that I blush to look upon.
    My very hairs do mutiny; for the white
    Reprove the brown for rashness, and they them
    For fear and doting. Friends, be gone; you shall
    Have letters from me to some friends that will
    Sweep your way for you. Pray you look not sad,
    Nor make replies of loathness; take the hint
    Which my despair proclaims. Let that be left
    Which leaves itself. To the sea-side straight way.
    I will possess you of that ship and treasure.
    Leave me, I pray, a little; pray you now;
    Nay, do so, for indeed I have lost command;
    Therefore I pray you. I'll see you by and by.    [Sits down]
  EROS. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
ANTONY
OS. Nay, gentle madam, to him! Comfort him.
  IRAS. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS

ANTONY
AS. Do, most dear Queen.
  CHARMIAN.

TONY. Fall not a tear, I say; one of them rates
  ANTONY. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
ANTONY
TONY. Fall not a tear, I say; one of them rates
    All that is won and lost. Give me a kiss;
    Even this repays me.
    We sent our schoolmaster; is 'a come back?
    Love, I am full of lead. Some wine,
    Within there, and our viands! Fortune knows
    We scorn her most when most she offers blows.         Exeunt
                         SCENE XII.
                   CAESAR'S camp in Egypt
  CAESAR.

ESAR. Let him appear that's come from Antony.

VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA

OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
LABELLA. Caesar, 'tis his schoolmaster:
    An argument that he is pluck'd, when hither
    He sends so poor a pinion of his wing,
    Which had superfluous kings for messengers
    Not many moons gone by.
  CAESAR.

  ANTONY. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
TONY. To him again. Tell him he wears the rose
    Of youth upon him; from which the world should note
    Something particular. His coin, ships, legions,
    May be a coward's whose ministers would prevail
    Under the service of a child as soon
    As i' th' command of Caesar. I dare him therefore
    To lay his gay comparisons apart,
    And answer me declin'd, sword against sword,
    Ourselves alone. I'll write it. Follow me.
                                    Exeunt ANTONY and EUPHRONIUS
  EUPHRONIUS. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
PHRONIUS. [Aside] Yes, like enough high-battled Caesar will
  EUPHRONIUS. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
PHRONIUS. [Aside] Yes, like enough high-battled Caesar will
    Unstate his happiness, and be stag'd to th' show
    Against a sworder! I see men's judgments are
    A parcel of their fortunes, and things outward
    Do draw the inward quality after them,
    To suffer all alike. That he should dream,
    Knowing all measures, the full Caesar will
    Answer his emptiness! Caesar, thou hast subdu'd
    His judgment too.
  SERVANT. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA

EUPHRONIUS
RVANT. A messenger from Caesar.
  CLEOPATRA.

EOPATRA. What, no more ceremony? See, my women!
    Against the blown rose may they stop their nose
    That kneel'd unto the buds. Admit him, sir.     Exit SERVANT
  ENOBARBUS. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA

OBARBUS. [Aside] Mine honesty and I begin to square.
  ENOBARBUS. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
THYREUS
OBARBUS. [Aside] Mine honesty and I begin to square.
    The loyalty well held to fools does make
    Our faith mere folly. Yet he that can endure
    To follow with allegiance a fall'n lord
    Does conquer him that did his master conquer,
    And earns a place i' th' story.
  CLEOPATRA. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

    As it rain'd kisses.

  CLEOPATRA.

  ANTONY. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
TONY. To let a fellow that will take rewards,
    And say 'God quit you!' be familiar with
    My playfellow, your hand, this kingly seal
    And plighter of high hearts! O that I were
    Upon the hill of Basan to outroar
    The horned herd! For I have savage cause,
    And to proclaim it civilly were like
    A halter'd neck which does the hangman thank
    For being yare about him.
  SERVANT. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
RVANT. Soundly, my lord.
  ANTONY.

  ANTONY. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
ENOBARBUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
TONY. If that thy father live, let him repent
    Thou wast not made his daughter; and be thou sorry
    To follow Caesar in his triumph, since
    Thou hast been whipt for following him. Henceforth
    The white hand of a lady fever thee!
    Shake thou to look on't. Get thee back to Caesar;
    Tell him thy entertainment; look thou say
    He makes me angry with him; for he seems
    Proud and disdainful, harping on what I am,
    Not what he knew I was. He makes me angry;
    And at this time most easy 'tis to do't,
    When my good stars, that were my former guides,
    Have empty left their orbs and shot their fires
    Into th' abysm of hell. If he mislike
    My speech and what is done, tell him he has
    Hipparchus, my enfranched bondman, whom
    He may at pleasure whip or hang or torture,
    As he shall like, to quit me. Urge it thou.
    Hence with thy stripes, be gone.                Exit THYREUS
  CLEOPATRA. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

  ANTONY. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
TONY. Do so, we'll speak to them; and to-night I'll force
    The wine peep through their scars. Come on, my queen,
    There's sap in't yet. The next time I do fight
    I'll make death love me; for I will contend
    Even with his pestilent scythe.     Exeunt all but ENOBARBUS
  ENOBARBUS. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. Now he'll outstare the lightning. To be furious
  ENOBARBUS. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
OBARBUS. Now he'll outstare the lightning. To be furious
    Is to be frighted out of fear, and in that mood
    The dove will peck the estridge; and I see still
    A diminution in our captain's brain
    Restores his heart. When valour preys on reason,
    It eats the sword it fights with. I will seek
    Some way to leave him.                                  Exit
                      ACT IV. SCENE I.
              CAESAR'S camp before Alexandria
  CAESAR.

  MAECENAS.

  CAESAR. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
ESAR. Let our best heads
    Know that to-morrow the last of many battles
    We mean to fight. Within our files there are
    Of those that serv'd Mark Antony but late
    Enough to fetch him in. See it done;
    And feast the army; we have store to do't,
    And they have earn'd the waste. Poor Antony!          Exeunt
                          SCENE II.
               Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace

                           SCENE IV.
               Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace
  ANTONY.

EROS
EOPATRA. Is not this buckled well?
  ANTONY. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. Rarely, rarely!
  ANTONY. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. Rarely, rarely!
    He that unbuckles this, till we do please
    To daff't for our repose, shall hear a storm.
    Thou fumblest, Eros, and my queen's a squire
    More tight at this than thou. Dispatch. O love,
    That thou couldst see my wars to-day, and knew'st
    The royal occupation! Thou shouldst see
    A workman in't.
  SOLDIER. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
LDIER. A thousand, sir,
  SOLDIER. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA

CAPTAINS
POMPEY

OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
LDIER. A thousand, sir,
    Early though't be, have on their riveted trim,
    And at the port expect you.
                            [Shout. Flourish of trumpets within]
  CAPTAIN.

PTAIN. The morn is fair. Good morrow, General.
  ALL. 
17
VENTIDIUS

  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. 'Tis well blown, lads.
  ANTONY. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
EROS
TONY. 'Tis well blown, lads.
    This morning, like the spirit of a youth
    That means to be of note, begins betimes.
    So, so. Come, give me that. This way. Well said.
    Fare thee well, dame, whate'er becomes of me.
    This is a soldier's kiss. Rebukeable,
    And worthy shameful check it were, to stand
    On more mechanic compliment; I'll leave thee
    Now like a man of steel. You that will fight,
    Follow me close; I'll bring you to't. Adieu.
                      Exeunt ANTONY, EROS, CAPTAINS and soldiers
  CHARMIAN. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
EROS
ARMIAN. Please you retire to your chamber?
  CLEOPATRA. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY

ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
EROS
EOPATRA. Lead me.
  CLEOPATRA. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Lead me.
    He goes forth gallantly. That he and Caesar might
    Determine this great war in single fight!
    Then, Antony- but now. Well, on.                      Exeunt

  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. Go, Eros, send his treasure after; do it;
    Detain no jot, I charge thee. Write to him-
    I will subscribe- gentle adieus and greetings;
    Say that I wish he never find more cause
    To change a master. O, my fortunes have
    Corrupted honest men! Dispatch. Enobarbus!            Exeunt
                         SCENE VI.
                 Alexandria. CAESAR'S camp

    Prove this a prosp'rous day, the three-nook'd world
    Shall bear the olive freely.
  MESSENGER.

EROS
ESAR. Go charge Agrippa
    Plant those that have revolted in the vant,
    That Antony may seem to spend his fury
    Upon himself.                       Exeunt all but ENOBARBUS
  ENOBARBUS. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
OBARBUS. Alexas did revolt and went to Jewry on
  ENOBARBUS. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
OBARBUS. Alexas did revolt and went to Jewry on
    Affairs of Antony; there did dissuade
    Great Herod to incline himself to Caesar
    And leave his master Antony. For this pains
    Casaer hath hang'd him. Canidius and the rest
    That fell away have entertainment, but
    No honourable trust. I have done ill,
    Of which I do accuse myself so sorely
    That I will joy no more.
  SOLDIER. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY

CAESAR

EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
LDIER. Enobarbus, Antony
  ENOBARBUS. 
17

  SOLDIER. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

  ENOBARBUS. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
OBARBUS. I am alone the villain of the earth,
  ENOBARBUS. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
OBARBUS. I am alone the villain of the earth,
    And feel I am so most. O Antony,
    Thou mine of bounty, how wouldst thou have paid
    My better service, when my turpitude
    Thou dost so crown with gold! This blows my heart.
    If swift thought break it not, a swifter mean
    Shall outstrike thought; but thought will do't, I feel.
    I fight against thee? No! I will go seek
    Some ditch wherein to die; the foul'st best fits
    My latter part of life.                                 Exit
                          SCENE VII.
             Field of battle between the camps
  AGRIPPA. 
17

AGRIPPA

RIPPA. Retire. We have engag'd ourselves too far.
  AGRIPPA. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

CLEOPATRA
SCARUS

POMPEY

OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
RIPPA. Retire. We have engag'd ourselves too far.
    Caesar himself has work, and our oppression
    Exceeds what we expected.                             Exeunt
  SCARUS.

ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. I will reward thee
    Once for thy sprightly comfort, and tenfold
    For thy good valour. Come thee on.
    SCARUS. I'll halt after.                              Exeunt
                         SCENE VIII.
               Under the walls of Alexandria
  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. We have beat him to his camp. Run one before
  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. We have beat him to his camp. Run one before
    And let the Queen know of our gests. To-morrow,
    Before the sun shall see's, we'll spill the blood
    That has to-day escap'd. I thank you all;
    For doughty-handed are you, and have fought
    Not as you serv'd the cause, but as't had been
    Each man's like mine; you have shown all Hectors.
    Enter the city, clip your wives, your friends,
    Tell them your feats; whilst they with joyful tears
    Wash the congealment from your wounds and kiss
    The honour'd gashes whole.
  CLEOPATRA. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Lord of lords!
  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER

  CLEOPATRA.

  ANTONY.

VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS

POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS

ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. He has deserv'd it, were it carbuncled
  ANTONY. 
18
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. He has deserv'd it, were it carbuncled
    Like holy Phoebus' car. Give me thy hand.
    Through Alexandria make a jolly march;
    Bear our hack'd targets like the men that owe them.
    Had our great palace the capacity
    To camp this host, we all would sup together,
    And drink carouses to the next day's fate,
    Which promises royal peril. Trumpeters,
    With brazen din blast you the city's ear;
    Make mingle with our rattling tabourines,
    That heaven and earth may strike their sounds together
    Applauding our approach.                              Exeunt

  ANTONY. 
18
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. I would they'd fight i' th' fire or i' th' air;
    We'd fight there too. But this it is, our foot
    Upon the hills adjoining to the city
    Shall stay with us- Order for sea is given;
    They have put forth the haven-
    Where their appointment we may best discover
    And look on their endeavour.                          Exeunt
                         SCENE XI.
                    Between the camps

SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
ESAR. But being charg'd, we will be still by land,
    Which, as I take't, we shall; for his best force
    Is forth to man his galleys. To the vales,
    And hold our best advantage.                          Exeunt
                         SCENE XII.
                  A hill near Alexandria
  ANTONY.

TONY. Yet they are not join'd. Where yond pine does stand
  SCARUS.

ARUS. Swallows have built
  SCARUS. 
18
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
ARUS. Swallows have built
    In Cleopatra's sails their nests. The augurers
    Say they know not, they cannot tell; look grimly,
    And dare not speak their knowledge. Antony
    Is valiant and dejected; and by starts
    His fretted fortunes give him hope and fear
    Of what he has and has not.
                            [Alarum afar off, as at a sea-fight]
  ANTONY. 
18
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
SCARUS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. All is lost!
  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. All is lost!
    This foul Egyptian hath betrayed me.
    My fleet hath yielded to the foe, and yonder
    They cast their caps up and carouse together
    Like friends long lost. Triple-turn'd whore! 'tis thou
    Hast sold me to this novice; and my heart
    Makes only wars on thee. Bid them all fly;
    For when I am reveng'd upon my charm,
    I have done all. Bid them all fly; begone.       Exit SCARUS
  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. All is lost!
    This foul Egyptian hath betrayed me.
    My fleet hath yielded to the foe, and yonder
    They cast their caps up and carouse together
    Like friends long lost. Triple-turn'd whore! 'tis thou
    Hast sold me to this novice; and my heart
    Makes only wars on thee. Bid them all fly;
    For when I am reveng'd upon my charm,
    I have done all. Bid them all fly; begone.       Exit SCARUS
    O sun, thy uprise shall I see no more!
    Fortune and Antony part here; even here
    Do we shake hands. All come to this? The hearts
    That spaniel'd me at heels, to whom I gave
    Their wishes, do discandy, melt their sweets
    On blossoming Caesar; and this pine is bark'd
    That overtopp'd them all. Betray'd I am.
    O this false soul of Egypt! this grave charm-
    Whose eye beck'd forth my wars and call'd them home,
    Whose bosom was my crownet, my chief end-
    Like a right gypsy hath at fast and loose
    Beguil'd me to the very heart of loss.
    What, Eros, Eros!
  CLEOPATRA. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR

EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. Why is my lord enrag'd against his love?
  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA

POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA

ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving
  ANTONY. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving
    And blemish Caesar's triumph. Let him take thee
    And hoist thee up to the shouting plebeians;
    Follow his chariot, like the greatest spot
    Of all thy sex; most monster-like, be shown
    For poor'st diminutives, for doits, and let
    Patient Octavia plough thy visage up
    With her prepared nails.                      Exit CLEOPATRA
  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving
    And blemish Caesar's triumph. Let him take thee
    And hoist thee up to the shouting plebeians;
    Follow his chariot, like the greatest spot
    Of all thy sex; most monster-like, be shown
    For poor'st diminutives, for doits, and let
    Patient Octavia plough thy visage up
    With her prepared nails.                      Exit CLEOPATRA
    'Tis well th'art gone,
    If it be well to live; but better 'twere
    Thou fell'st into my fury, for one death
    Might have prevented many. Eros, ho!
    The shirt of Nessus is upon me; teach me,
    Alcides, thou mine ancestor, thy rage;
    Let me lodge Lichas on the horns o' th' moon,
    And with those hands that grasp'd the heaviest club
    Subdue my worthiest self. The witch shall die.
    To the young Roman boy she hath sold me, and I fall
    Under this plot. She dies for't. Eros, ho!              Exit
                          SCENE XIII.
               Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace
  CLEOPATRA.

ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. To th' monument!
    Mardian, go tell him I have slain myself;
    Say that the last I spoke was 'Antony'
    And word it, prithee, piteously. Hence, Mardian,
    And bring me how he takes my death. To th' monument!
                                                          Exeunt

TONY. My good knave Eros, now thy captain is
  ANTONY. 
18
MARDIAN
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. My good knave Eros, now thy captain is
    Even such a body. Here I am Antony;
    Yet cannot hold this visible shape, my knave.
    I made these wars for Egypt; and the Queen-
    Whose heart I thought I had, for she had mine,
    Which, whilst it was mine, had annex'd unto't
    A million moe, now lost- she, Eros, has
    Pack'd cards with Caesar, and false-play'd my glory
    Unto an enemy's triumph.
    Nay, weep not, gentle Eros; there is left us
    Ourselves to end ourselves.
  MARDIAN. 
18
MARDIAN
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA

  ANTONY.

CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
  ANTONY. 
16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

ANTONY
CENTURION
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
    Off, pluck off!
    The sevenfold shield of Ajax cannot keep
    The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
    Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
    Crack thy frail case. Apace, Eros, apace.-
    No more a soldier. Bruised pieces, go;
    You have been nobly borne.- From me awhile.        Exit EROS
  ANTONY. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

CLEOPATRA

OCTAVIA

CANIDIUS

ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
    Off, pluck off!
    The sevenfold shield of Ajax cannot keep
    The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
    Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
    Crack thy frail case. Apace, Eros, apace.-
    No more a soldier. Bruised pieces, go;
    You have been nobly borne.- From me awhile.        Exit EROS
    I will o'ertake thee, Cleopatra, and
    Weep for my pardon. So it must be, for now
    All length is torture. Since the torch is out,
    Lie down, and stray no farther. Now all labour
    Mars what it does; yea, very force entangles
    Itself with strength. Seal then, and all is done.
    Eros!- I come, my queen.- Eros!- Stay for me;
    Where souls do couch on flowers, we'll hand in hand,
    And with our sprightly port make the ghosts gaze.
    Dido and her Aeneas shall want troops,
    And all the haunt be ours.- Come, Eros, Eros!
  EROS.

18
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
DERCETAS
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR

CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Thrice nobler than myself!
    Thou teachest me, O valiant Eros, what
    I should, and thou couldst not. My queen and Eros
    Have, by their brave instruction, got upon me
    A nobleness in record. But I will be
    A bridegroom in my death, and run into't
    As to a lover's bed. Come, then; and, Eros,
    Thy master dies thy scholar. To do thus
                                          [Falling on his sword]
    I learn'd of thee. How? not dead? not dead?-
    The guard, ho! O, dispatch me!
  FIRST

VENTIDIUS

SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Nay, good my fellows, do not please sharp fate
    To grace it with your sorrows. Bid that welcome
    Which comes to punish us, and we punish it,
    Seeming to bear it lightly. Take me up.
    I have led you oft; carry me now, good friends,
    And have my thanks for all.           Exeunt, hearing ANTONY
                         SCENE XV.
                   Alexandria. A monument
  CLEOPATRA.

EOPATRA. No, I will not.
    All strange and terrible events are welcome,
    But comforts we despise; our size of sorrow,
    Proportion'd to our cause, must be as great
    As that which makes it.
  DIOMEDES.

CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. O, quick, or I am gone.
  CLEOPATRA.

VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
DIOMEDES
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. No more but e'en a woman, and commanded
  CLEOPATRA. 
18
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
DIOMEDES
CAPTAINS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
SERVANTS
ANTONY With
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. No more but e'en a woman, and commanded
    By such poor passion as the maid that milks
    And does the meanest chares. It were for me
    To throw my sceptre at the injurious gods;
    To tell them that this world did equal theirs
    Till they had stol'n our jewel. All's but nought;
    Patience is sottish, and impatience does
    Become a dog that's mad. Then is it sin
    To rush into the secret house of death
    Ere death dare come to us? How do you, women?
    What, what! good cheer! Why, how now, Charmian!
    My noble girls! Ah, women, women, look,
    Our lamp is spent, it's out! Good sirs, take heart.
    We'll bury him; and then, what's brave, what's noble,
    Let's do it after the high Roman fashion,
    And make death proud to take us. Come, away;
    This case of that huge spirit now is cold.
    Ah, women, women! Come; we have no friend
    But resolution and the briefest end.
                   Exeunt; those above hearing off ANTONY'S body
                       ACT V. SCENE I.
                  Alexandria. CAESAR'S camp
  CAESAR.

20
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
DERCETAS With
ESAR. O Antony,
    I have follow'd thee to this! But we do lance
    Diseases in our bodies. I must perforce
    Have shown to thee such a declining day
    Or look on thine; we could not stall together
    In the whole world. But yet let me lament,
    With tears as sovereign as the blood of hearts,
    That thou, my brother, my competitor
    In top of all design, my mate in empire,
    Friend and companion in the front of war,
    The arm of mine own body, and the heart
    Where mine his thoughts did kindle- that our stars,
    Unreconciliable, should divide
    Our equalness to this. Hear me, good friends-
  EGYPTIAN. 
20
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
DERCETAS With
YPTIAN. A poor Egyptian, yet the Queen, my mistress,
  CAESAR. 
20

  CAESAR. 
20
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
DERCETAS With
ESAR. Let him alone, for I remember now
    How he's employ'd; he shall in time be ready.
    Go with me to my tent, where you shall see
    How hardly I was drawn into this war,
    How calm and gentle I proceeded still
    In all my writings. Go with me, and see
    What I can show in this.                              Exeunt
                         SCENE II.
                Alexandria. The monument
  CLEOPATRA.

SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
DERCETAS With
EOPATRA. Where art thou, death?
  PROCULEIUS. 
20
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
DERCETAS With
OCULEIUS. O, temperance, lady!
  CLEOPATRA. 
20
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
DERCETAS With
EOPATRA. Sir, I will eat no meat; I'll not drink, sir;
  PROCULEIUS. 
20
VENTIDIUS

CENTURION

OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
DERCETAS With
OCULEIUS. You do extend
  PROCULEIUS. 
21
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
DERCETAS With
DOLABELLA
OCULEIUS. You do extend
    These thoughts of horror further than you shall
    Find cause in Caesar.
  DOLABELLA. 
21
VENTIDIUS

CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION

CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
CAESAR
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
DERCETAS With
DOLABELLA
LABELLA. Proculeius,
  PROCULEIUS. 
21

  DOLABELLA.

LABELLA. Most noble Empress, you have heard of me?
  CLEOPATRA. 
21

  DOLABELLA.

  CAESAR.

ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
DERCETAS With
DOLABELLA
EOPATRA. He words me, girls, he words me, that I should not
  IRAS.

20
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
CHARMIAN
DERCETAS With
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
    To fool their preparation and to conquer
    Their most absurd intents.
  CLEOPATRA. 
20
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
CHARMIAN
DERCETAS With
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
    To fool their preparation and to conquer
    Their most absurd intents.
    Now, Charmian!
    Show me, my women, like a queen. Go fetch
    My best attires. I am again for Cydnus,
    To meet Mark Antony. Sirrah, Iras, go.
    Now, noble Charmian, we'll dispatch indeed;
    And when thou hast done this chare, I'll give thee leave
    To play till doomsday. Bring our crown and all.
                                       Exit IRAS. A noise within
  CLEOPATRA. 
21
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
GUARDSMAN
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
CHARMIAN
DERCETAS With
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
    To fool their preparation and to conquer
    Their most absurd intents.
    Now, Charmian!
    Show me, my women, like a queen. Go fetch
    My best attires. I am again for Cydnus,
    To meet Mark Antony. Sirrah, Iras, go.
    Now, noble Charmian, we'll dispatch indeed;
    And when thou hast done this chare, I'll give thee leave
    To play till doomsday. Bring our crown and all.
                                       Exit IRAS. A noise within
    Wherefore's this noise?
  GUARDSMAN. 
21

21
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
MESSENGER
CENTURION
EROS
GUARDSMAN
EGYPTIAN
CANIDIUS
CAPTAINS
DIOMEDES
SERVANTS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
AGRIPPA
OCTAVIA
ANTONY With
CHARMIAN
DERCETAS With
EOPATRA. Let him come in.                     Exit GUARDSMAN
    What poor an instrument
    May do a noble deed! He brings me liberty.
    My resolution's plac'd, and I have nothing
    Of woman in me. Now from head to foot
    I am marble-constant; now the fleeting moon
    No planet is of mine.
  GUARDSMAN.

VENTIDIUS

DERCETAS With
DOLABELLA
ARMIAN. It is well done, and fitting for a princes
    Descended of so many royal kings.
    Ah, soldier!                                 [CHARMIAN dies]
  DOLABELLA. 
22
VENTIDIUS
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA

IRAS
CHARMIAN
DERCETAS With
DOLABELLA
LABELLA. Caesar, thy thoughts
    Touch their effects in this. Thyself art coming
    To see perform'd the dreaded act which thou
    So sought'st to hinder.
                      [Within: 'A way there, a way for Caesar!']
  DOLABELLA.

  IRAS, 
1
DEMETRIUS
  PHILO. 
1
DEMETRIUS
ILO. Nay, but this dotage of our general's
  PHILO. 
2
DEMETRIUS
ANTONY
ILO. Nay, but this dotage of our general's
    O'erflows the measure. Those his goodly eyes,
    That o'er the files and musters of the war
    Have glow'd like plated Mars, now bend, now turn,
    The office and devotion of their view
    Upon a tawny front. His captain's heart,
    Which in the scuffles of great fights hath burst
    The buckles on his breast, reneges all temper,
    And is become the bellows and the fan
    To cool a gipsy's lust.
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
DEMETRIUS
ANTONY
EOPATRA. If it be love indeed, tell me how much.
  ANTONY. 
2
DEMETRIUS
ANTONY
TONY. There's beggary in the love that can be reckon'd.
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
DEMETRIUS
ANTONY
EOPATRA. I'll set a bourn how far to be belov'd.
  ANTONY. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
TONY. Then must thou needs find out new heaven, new earth.
  MESSENGER. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
SSENGER. News, my good lord, from Rome.
  ANTONY. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
TONY. Grates me the sum.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Nay, hear them, Antony.
  ANTONY. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
TONY. How, my love?
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Perchance? Nay, and most like,
  ANTONY. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
TONY. Let Rome in Tiber melt, and the wide arch
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Excellent falsehood!
  ANTONY. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
TONY. But stirr'd by Cleopatra.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Hear the ambassadors.
  ANTONY. 
3
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ANTONY
TONY. Fie, wrangling queen!
  ANTONY. 
2
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
TONY. Fie, wrangling queen!
    Whom everything becomes- to chide, to laugh,
    To weep; whose every passion fully strives
    To make itself in thee fair and admir'd.
    No messenger but thine, and all alone
    To-night we'll wander through the streets and note
    The qualities of people. Come, my queen;
    Last night you did desire it. Speak not to us.
                     Exeunt ANTONY and CLEOPATRA, with the train
  DEMETRIUS. 
2
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
METRIUS. Is Caesar with Antonius priz'd so slight?
  PHILO. 
2
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
ILO. Sir, sometimes when he is not Antony,
  DEMETRIUS. 
2
DEMETRIUS
MESSENGER
METRIUS. I am full sorry
  DEMETRIUS.

CHARMIAN
  CHARMIAN. 
1
CHARMIAN
ARMIAN. Lord Alexas, sweet Alexas, most anything Alexas, almost
  ALEXAS. 
1
CHARMIAN
EXAS. Soothsayer!
  SOOTHSAYER. 
1
CHARMIAN
OTHSAYER. Your will?
  CHARMIAN. 
1
CHARMIAN
ARMIAN. Is this the man? Is't you, sir, that know things?
  SOOTHSAYER. 
1
CHARMIAN
OTHSAYER. In nature's infinite book of secrecy
  ALEXAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
EXAS. Show him your hand.
  ENOBARBUS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
OBARBUS. Bring in the banquet quickly; wine enough
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. Good, sir, give me good fortune.
  SOOTHSAYER. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
OTHSAYER. I make not, but foresee.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. Pray, then, foresee me one.
  SOOTHSAYER. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
OTHSAYER. You shall be yet far fairer than you are.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. He means in flesh.
  IRAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
AS. No, you shall paint when you are old.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. Wrinkles forbid!
  ALEXAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
EXAS. Vex not his prescience; be attentive.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. Hush!
  SOOTHSAYER. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
OTHSAYER. You shall be more beloving than beloved.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. I had rather heat my liver with drinking.
  ALEXAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
EXAS. Nay, hear him.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. Good now, some excellent fortune! Let me be married to
  SOOTHSAYER. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
OTHSAYER. You shall outlive the lady whom you serve.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. O, excellent! I love long life better than figs.
  SOOTHSAYER. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
OTHSAYER. You have seen and prov'd a fairer former fortune
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. Then belike my children shall have no names.
  SOOTHSAYER. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
OTHSAYER. If every of your wishes had a womb,
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. Out, fool! I forgive thee for a witch.
  ALEXAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
EXAS. You think none but your sheets are privy to your wishes.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. Nay, come, tell Iras hers.
  ALEXAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
EXAS. We'll know all our fortunes.
  ENOBARBUS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
OBARBUS. Mine, and most of our fortunes, to-night, shall be-
  IRAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
AS. There's a palm presages chastity, if nothing else.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. E'en as the o'erflowing Nilus presageth famine.
  IRAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
AS. Go, you wild bedfellow, you cannot soothsay.
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. Nay, if an oily palm be not a fruitful prognostication, I
  SOOTHSAYER. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
OTHSAYER. Your fortunes are alike.
  IRAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
AS. But how, but how? Give me particulars.
  SOOTHSAYER. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
OTHSAYER. I have said.
  IRAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
AS. Am I not an inch of fortune better than she?
  CHARMIAN. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
ARMIAN. Well, if you were but an inch of fortune better than I,
  IRAS. 
2
CHARMIAN
ENOBARBUS
AS. Not in my husband's nose.
  CHARMIAN.

ENOBARBUS

    would make themselves whores but they'ld do't!

ENOBARBUS
TONY. Let him appear.
    These strong Egyptian fetters I must break,
    Or lose myself in dotage.
  SECOND 
4

MESSENGER
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
COND MESSENGER. Fulvia thy wife is dead.

  ANTONY. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. Forbear me.                             Exit MESSENGER
  ANTONY. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. Forbear me.                             Exit MESSENGER
    There's a great spirit gone! Thus did I desire it.
    What our contempts doth often hurl from us
    We wish it ours again; the present pleasure,
    By revolution low'ring, does become
    The opposite of itself. She's good, being gone;
    The hand could pluck her back that shov'd her on.
    I must from this enchanting queen break off.
    Ten thousand harms, more than the ills I know,
    My idleness doth hatch. How now, Enobarbus!
  ENOBARBUS. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
OBARBUS. What's your pleasure, sir?
  ANTONY. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
TONY. I must with haste from hence.
  ENOBARBUS. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS
OBARBUS. Why, then we kill all our women. We see how mortal an
  ANTONY. 
3
CHARMIAN
ANTONY
ENOBARBUS

ENOBARBUS

  ANTONY.

ENOBARBUS
