TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
  ANTONY. 
13
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
    Off, pluck off!
    The sevenfold shield of Ajax cannot keep
    The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
    Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
    Crack thy frail case. Apace, Eros, apace.-
    No more a soldier. Bruised pieces, go;
    You have been nobly borne.- From me awhile.        Exit EROS
  ANTONY. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
    Off, pluck off!
    The sevenfold shield of Ajax cannot keep
    The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
    Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
    Crack thy frail case. Apace, Eros, apace.-
    No more a soldier. Bruised pieces, go;
    You have been nobly borne.- From me awhile.        Exit EROS
    I will o'ertake thee, Cleopatra, and
    Weep for my pardon. So it must be, for now
    All length is torture. Since the torch is out,
    Lie down, and stray no farther. Now all labour
    Mars what it does; yea, very force entangles
    Itself with strength. Seal then, and all is done.
    Eros!- I come, my queen.- Eros!- Stay for me;
    Where souls do couch on flowers, we'll hand in hand,
    And with our sprightly port make the ghosts gaze.
    Dido and her Aeneas shall want troops,
    And all the haunt be ours.- Come, Eros, Eros!
  EROS.

  ANTONY. 
14
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
POMPEY

  ANTONY. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
DERCETAS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Thrice nobler than myself!
    Thou teachest me, O valiant Eros, what
    I should, and thou couldst not. My queen and Eros
    Have, by their brave instruction, got upon me
    A nobleness in record. But I will be
    A bridegroom in my death, and run into't
    As to a lover's bed. Come, then; and, Eros,
    Thy master dies thy scholar. To do thus
                                          [Falling on his sword]
    I learn'd of thee. How? not dead? not dead?-
    The guard, ho! O, dispatch me!
  FIRST 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
DERCETAS
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
RST GUARD. What's the noise?
  ANTONY.

  ANTONY. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
TONY. Nay, good my fellows, do not please sharp fate
    To grace it with your sorrows. Bid that welcome
    Which comes to punish us, and we punish it,
    Seeming to bear it lightly. Take me up.
    I have led you oft; carry me now, good friends,
    And have my thanks for all.           Exeunt, hearing ANTONY
                         SCENE XV.
                   Alexandria. A monument
  CLEOPATRA.

ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. No, I will not.
    All strange and terrible events are welcome,
    But comforts we despise; our size of sorrow,
    Proportion'd to our cause, must be as great
    As that which makes it.
  DIOMEDES.

15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. No more but e'en a woman, and commanded
  CLEOPATRA. 
15
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. No more but e'en a woman, and commanded
    By such poor passion as the maid that milks
    And does the meanest chares. It were for me
    To throw my sceptre at the injurious gods;
    To tell them that this world did equal theirs
    Till they had stol'n our jewel. All's but nought;
    Patience is sottish, and impatience does
    Become a dog that's mad. Then is it sin
    To rush into the secret house of death
    Ere death dare come to us? How do you, women?
    What, what! good cheer! Why, how now, Charmian!
    My noble girls! Ah, women, women, look,
    Our lamp is spent, it's out! Good sirs, take heart.
    We'll bury him; and then, what's brave, what's noble,
    Let's do it after the high Roman fashion,
    And make death proud to take us. Come, away;
    This case of that huge spirit now is cold.
    Ah, women, women! Come; we have no friend
    But resolution and the briefest end.
                   Exeunt; those above hearing off ANTONY'S body
                       ACT V. SCENE I.
                  Alexandria. CAESAR'S camp
  CAESAR.

SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
ESAR. O Antony,
  CAESAR. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
ESAR. O Antony,
    I have follow'd thee to this! But we do lance
    Diseases in our bodies. I must perforce
    Have shown to thee such a declining day
    Or look on thine; we could not stall together
    In the whole world. But yet let me lament,
    With tears as sovereign as the blood of hearts,
    That thou, my brother, my competitor
    In top of all design, my mate in empire,
    Friend and companion in the front of war,
    The arm of mine own body, and the heart
    Where mine his thoughts did kindle- that our stars,
    Unreconciliable, should divide
    Our equalness to this. Hear me, good friends-
  EGYPTIAN. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
YPTIAN. A poor Egyptian, yet the Queen, my mistress,
  CAESAR. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
ESAR. Bid her have good heart.
  EGYPTIAN. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

YPTIAN. So the gods preserve thee!                      Exit
  CAESAR.

  PROCULEIUS.

  ALL.

VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT

L. Dolabella!
  CAESAR. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
ESAR. Let him alone, for I remember now
  CAESAR. 
17
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
ESAR. Let him alone, for I remember now
    How he's employ'd; he shall in time be ready.
    Go with me to my tent, where you shall see
    How hardly I was drawn into this war,
    How calm and gentle I proceeded still
    In all my writings. Go with me, and see
    What I can show in this.                              Exeunt
                         SCENE II.
                Alexandria. The monument
  CLEOPATRA. 
17

SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
CAESAR
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
DOLABELLA
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. And may, through all the world. 'Tis yours, and we,
  CAESAR. 
18
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

CANIDIUS
DOLABELLA
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
ESAR. You shall advise me in all for Cleopatra.
  CLEOPATRA. 
18

EOPATRA. This is the brief of money, plate, and jewels,
  SELEUCUS.

                           Flourish. Exeunt CAESAR and his train
  CLEOPATRA.

  CLEOPATRA.

16
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY

OCTAVIA
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
  CLEOPATRA. 
17
CHARMIAN
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
    To fool their preparation and to conquer
    Their most absurd intents.
  CLEOPATRA. 
17
CHARMIAN
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
    To fool their preparation and to conquer
    Their most absurd intents.
    Now, Charmian!
    Show me, my women, like a queen. Go fetch
    My best attires. I am again for Cydnus,
    To meet Mark Antony. Sirrah, Iras, go.
    Now, noble Charmian, we'll dispatch indeed;
    And when thou hast done this chare, I'll give thee leave
    To play till doomsday. Bring our crown and all.
                                       Exit IRAS. A noise within
  CLEOPATRA. 
18
CHARMIAN
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
GUARDSMAN
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
    To fool their preparation and to conquer
    Their most absurd intents.
    Now, Charmian!
    Show me, my women, like a queen. Go fetch
    My best attires. I am again for Cydnus,
    To meet Mark Antony. Sirrah, Iras, go.
    Now, noble Charmian, we'll dispatch indeed;
    And when thou hast done this chare, I'll give thee leave
    To play till doomsday. Bring our crown and all.
                                       Exit IRAS. A noise within
    Wherefore's this noise?
  GUARDSMAN. 
18
CHARMIAN
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
GUARDSMAN
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
ARDSMAN. Here is a rural fellow
  CLEOPATRA. 
17
CHARMIAN
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. Let him come in.                     Exit GUARDSMAN
  CLEOPATRA. 
18
CHARMIAN
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA
SERVANT
CLEOPATRA
EGYPTIAN
DERCETAS
DIOMEDES
POMPEY
SOLDIER
OCTAVIA
GUARDSMAN
MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
EOPATRA. Let him come in.                     Exit GUARDSMAN
    What poor an instrument
    May do a noble deed! He brings me liberty.
    My resolution's plac'd, and I have nothing
    Of woman in me. Now from head to foot
    I am marble-constant; now the fleeting moon
    No planet is of mine.
  GUARDSMAN. 
18
CHARMIAN
VENTIDIUS
AGRIPPA

MESSENGER
CANIDIUS
EUPHRONIUS
ANTONY
CENTURION
EROS
ARDSMAN. This is the man.
  CLEOPATRA.

  CLOWN.

OWN. Truly, I have him. But I would not be the party that should
  CLEOPATRA.

LABELLA. Caesar, thy thoughts
    Touch their effects in this. Thyself art coming
    To see perform'd the dreaded act which thou
    So sought'st to hinder.
                      [Within: 'A way there, a way for Caesar!']

  CHARMIAN.

  SOOTHSAYER. 
0

  CHARMIAN.

  IRAS. 
0
AS. No, you shall paint when you are old.
  CHARMIAN. 
0
ARMIAN. Wrinkles forbid!
  ALEXAS. 
0
EXAS. Vex not his prescience; be attentive.
  CHARMIAN. 
0
ARMIAN. Hush!
  SOOTHSAYER. 
0
OTHSAYER. You shall be more beloving than beloved.
  CHARMIAN. 
0

0

  CHARMIAN.

  SOOTHSAYER. 
0

  CHARMIAN.

0

  CHARMIAN.

EXAS. We'll know all our fortunes.

0

  CLEOPATRA.

  ANTONY. 
1
ENOBARBUS
TONY. Forbear me.                             Exit MESSENGER
    There's a great spirit gone! Thus did I desire it.
    What our contempts doth often hurl from us
    We wish it ours again; the present pleasure,
    By revolution low'ring, does become
    The opposite of itself. She's good, being gone;
    The hand could pluck her back that shov'd her on.
    I must from this enchanting queen break off.
    Ten thousand harms, more than the ills I know,
    My idleness doth hatch. How now, Enobarbus!
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
ENOBARBUS
OBARBUS. What's your pleasure, sir?
  ANTONY.

  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. To let a fellow that will take rewards,
    And say 'God quit you!' be familiar with
    My playfellow, your hand, this kingly seal
    And plighter of high hearts! O that I were
    Upon the hill of Basan to outroar
    The horned herd! For I have savage cause,
    And to proclaim it civilly were like
    A halter'd neck which does the hangman thank
    For being yare about him.
  SERVANT. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
RVANT. Soundly, my lord.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Cried he? and begg'd 'a pardon?
  SERVANT. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
RVANT. He did ask favour.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. If that thy father live, let him repent
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. If that thy father live, let him repent
    Thou wast not made his daughter; and be thou sorry
    To follow Caesar in his triumph, since
    Thou hast been whipt for following him. Henceforth
    The white hand of a lady fever thee!
    Shake thou to look on't. Get thee back to Caesar;
    Tell him thy entertainment; look thou say
    He makes me angry with him; for he seems
    Proud and disdainful, harping on what I am,
    Not what he knew I was. He makes me angry;
    And at this time most easy 'tis to do't,
    When my good stars, that were my former guides,
    Have empty left their orbs and shot their fires
    Into th' abysm of hell. If he mislike
    My speech and what is done, tell him he has
    Hipparchus, my enfranched bondman, whom
    He may at pleasure whip or hang or torture,
    As he shall like, to quit me. Urge it thou.
    Hence with thy stripes, be gone.                Exit THYREUS

  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. 'Tis well blown, lads.
    This morning, like the spirit of a youth
    That means to be of note, begins betimes.
    So, so. Come, give me that. This way. Well said.
    Fare thee well, dame, whate'er becomes of me.
    This is a soldier's kiss. Rebukeable,
    And worthy shameful check it were, to stand
    On more mechanic compliment; I'll leave thee
    Now like a man of steel. You that will fight,
    Follow me close; I'll bring you to't. Adieu.
                      Exeunt ANTONY, EROS, CAPTAINS and soldiers

SERVANT
RIPPA. Caesar, I shall.                                 Exit
  CAESAR. 
1
SERVANT
ESAR. The time of universal peace is near.
  MESSENGER. 
1
SERVANT
SSENGER. Antony
  CAESAR. 
1
SERVANT
ESAR. Go charge Agrippa
  CAESAR. 
1
SERVANT
ESAR. Go charge Agrippa
    Plant those that have revolted in the vant,
    That Antony may seem to spend his fury
    Upon himself.                       Exeunt all but ENOBARBUS
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
SERVANT
OBARBUS. Alexas did revolt and went to Jewry on
  SOLDIER. 
1
SERVANT
LDIER. Enobarbus, Antony
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
SERVANT
OBARBUS. I give it you.
  SOLDIER. 
1
SERVANT
LDIER. Mock not, Enobarbus.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
SERVANT
OBARBUS. I am alone the villain of the earth,
  AGRIPPA. 
1
SERVANT
RIPPA. Retire. We have engag'd ourselves too far.
  SCARUS. 
1
SERVANT
ARUS. O my brave Emperor, this is fought indeed!
  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. Thou bleed'st apace.
  SCARUS. 
1
SERVANT
ARUS. I had a wound here that was like a T,
  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. They do retire.
  SCARUS. 
1
SERVANT
ARUS. We'll beat'em into bench-holes. I have yet
  EROS. 
1
SERVANT
OS. They are beaten, sir, and our advantage serves
  SCARUS. 
1
SERVANT
ARUS. Let us score their backs
  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. I will reward thee
  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. We have beat him to his camp. Run one before
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
SERVANT
EOPATRA. Lord of lords!
  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. Mine nightingale,
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
SERVANT
EOPATRA. I'll give thee, friend,
  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. He has deserv'd it, were it carbuncled
  CENTURION. 
1
SERVANT
NTURION. If we be not reliev'd within this hour,
  FIRST

SERVANT
RST WATCH. This last day was
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
SERVANT
OBARBUS. O, bear me witness, night-
  SECOND 
1
SERVANT
COND WATCH. What man is this?
  FIRST 
1
SERVANT
RST WATCH. Stand close and list him.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
SERVANT

  CENTURION.

  SECOND

  ENOBARBUS. 
1
SERVANT
OBARBUS. O sovereign mistress of true melancholy,
  FIRST 
1
SERVANT
RST WATCH. Let's speak to him.
  CENTURION. 
1
SERVANT
NTURION. Let's hear him, for the things he speaks
  SECOND 
1
SERVANT

  CENTURION. 
1
SERVANT
NTURION. Swoons rather; for so bad a prayer as his
  FIRST 
1
SERVANT
RST WATCH. Go we to him.
  SECOND 
1
SERVANT
COND WATCH. Awake, sir, awake; speak to us.
  FIRST 
1
SERVANT
RST WATCH. Hear you, sir?
  CENTURION. 
1
SERVANT
NTURION. The hand of death hath raught him.
  SECOND 
1
SERVANT
COND WATCH. Come on, then;
  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. Their preparation is to-day by sea;
  SCARUS. 
1
SERVANT
ARUS. For both, my lord.
  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. I would they'd fight i' th' fire or i' th' air;
  CAESAR. 
1
SERVANT
ESAR. But being charg'd, we will be still by land,
  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. Yet they are not join'd. Where yond pine does stand
  SCARUS. 
1
SERVANT
ARUS. Swallows have built
  SCARUS. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
ARUS. Swallows have built
    In Cleopatra's sails their nests. The augurers
    Say they know not, they cannot tell; look grimly,
    And dare not speak their knowledge. Antony
    Is valiant and dejected; and by starts
    His fretted fortunes give him hope and fear
    Of what he has and has not.
                            [Alarum afar off, as at a sea-fight]
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. All is lost!
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. All is lost!
    This foul Egyptian hath betrayed me.
    My fleet hath yielded to the foe, and yonder
    They cast their caps up and carouse together
    Like friends long lost. Triple-turn'd whore! 'tis thou
    Hast sold me to this novice; and my heart
    Makes only wars on thee. Bid them all fly;
    For when I am reveng'd upon my charm,
    I have done all. Bid them all fly; begone.       Exit SCARUS
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Why is my lord enrag'd against his love?
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving
    And blemish Caesar's triumph. Let him take thee
    And hoist thee up to the shouting plebeians;
    Follow his chariot, like the greatest spot
    Of all thy sex; most monster-like, be shown
    For poor'st diminutives, for doits, and let
    Patient Octavia plough thy visage up
    With her prepared nails.                      Exit CLEOPATRA
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Help me, my women. O, he is more mad
  CHARMIAN. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
ARMIAN. To th'monument!
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
EOPATRA. To th' monument!
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Eros, thou yet behold'st me?
  EROS. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
OS. Ay, noble lord.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Sometime we see a cloud that's dragonish;
  EROS. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
OS. Ay, my lord.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. That which is now a horse, even with a thought
  EROS. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
OS. It does, my lord.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. My good knave Eros, now thy captain is
  MARDIAN. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
RDIAN. No, Antony;
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Hence, saucy eunuch; peace!
  MARDIAN. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
RDIAN. Death of one person can be paid but once,
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Dead then?
  MARDIAN. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
RDIAN. Dead.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
    Off, pluck off!
    The sevenfold shield of Ajax cannot keep
    The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
    Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
    Crack thy frail case. Apace, Eros, apace.-
    No more a soldier. Bruised pieces, go;
    You have been nobly borne.- From me awhile.        Exit EROS
  ANTONY. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
    Off, pluck off!
    The sevenfold shield of Ajax cannot keep
    The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
    Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
    Crack thy frail case. Apace, Eros, apace.-
    No more a soldier. Bruised pieces, go;
    You have been nobly borne.- From me awhile.        Exit EROS
    I will o'ertake thee, Cleopatra, and
    Weep for my pardon. So it must be, for now
    All length is torture. Since the torch is out,
    Lie down, and stray no farther. Now all labour
    Mars what it does; yea, very force entangles
    Itself with strength. Seal then, and all is done.
    Eros!- I come, my queen.- Eros!- Stay for me;
    Where souls do couch on flowers, we'll hand in hand,
    And with our sprightly port make the ghosts gaze.
    Dido and her Aeneas shall want troops,
    And all the haunt be ours.- Come, Eros, Eros!
  EROS. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
OS. What would my lord?
  ANTONY. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. Since Cleopatra died,
  EROS.

EROS
OS. The gods withhold me!
  ANTONY.

  EROS.

  ANTONY.

  CLEOPATRA. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
    To fool their preparation and to conquer
    Their most absurd intents.
                      Enter CHARMIAN
    Now, Charmian!
    Show me, my women, like a queen. Go fetch
    My best attires. I am again for Cydnus,
    To meet Mark Antony. Sirrah, Iras, go.
    Now, noble Charmian, we'll dispatch indeed;
    And when thou hast done this chare, I'll give thee leave
    To play till doomsday. Bring our crown and all.
                                       Exit IRAS. A noise within
  GUARDSMAN.

  CLEOPATRA. 
4
SERVANT
GUARDSMAN
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Let him come in.                     Exit GUARDSMAN
    What poor an instrument
    May do a noble deed! He brings me liberty.
    My resolution's plac'd, and I have nothing
    Of woman in me. Now from head to foot
    I am marble-constant; now the fleeting moon
    No planet is of mine.
  GUARDSMAN. 
4
SERVANT
GUARDSMAN

  ANTONY. 
1
ENOBARBUS
TONY. Forbear me.                             Exit MESSENGER
    There's a great spirit gone! Thus did I desire it.
    What our contempts doth often hurl from us
    We wish it ours again; the present pleasure,
    By revolution low'ring, does become
    The opposite of itself. She's good, being gone;
    The hand could pluck her back that shov'd her on.
    I must from this enchanting queen break off.
    Ten thousand harms, more than the ills I know,
    My idleness doth hatch. How now, Enobarbus!
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
ENOBARBUS
OBARBUS. What's your pleasure, sir?
  ANTONY. 
1
ENOBARBUS
TONY. I must with haste from hence.
  ENOBARBUS. 
1

0

  CHARMIAN.

  CLEOPATRA.

  CLEOPATRA.

ANTONY
EOPATRA. Your Caesar's father oft,
    When he hath mus'd of taking kingdoms in,
    Bestow'd his lips on that unworthy place,
    As it rain'd kisses.
  ANTONY. 
1
ANTONY
TONY. Favours, by Jove that thunders!
  THYREUS. 
1
ANTONY
YREUS. One that but performs
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
ANTONY
OBARBUS. [Aside] You will be whipt.
  ANTONY. 
1
ANTONY
TONY. Approach there.- Ah, you kite!- Now, gods and devils!
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
ANTONY
OBARBUS. 'Tis better playing with a lion's whelp
  ANTONY. 
1
ANTONY
TONY. Moon and stars!
  THYMUS. 
1
ANTONY
YMUS. Mark Antony-
  ANTONY. 
1
ANTONY
TONY. Tug him away. Being whipt,
  ANTONY. 
1
ANTONY
TONY. Tug him away. Being whipt,
    Bring him again: the Jack of Caesar's shall
    Bear us an errand to him.       Exeunt servants with THYREUS
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Good my lord-
  ANTONY. 
1
ANTONY
TONY. You have been a boggler ever.
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
ANTONY
EOPATRA. O, is't come to this?
  ANTONY. 
1
ANTONY
TONY. I found you as a morsel cold upon
  CLEOPATRA. 
1
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Wherefore is this?
  ANTONY. 
1
ANTONY
TONY. To let a fellow that will take rewards,
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. To let a fellow that will take rewards,
    And say 'God quit you!' be familiar with
    My playfellow, your hand, this kingly seal
    And plighter of high hearts! O that I were
    Upon the hill of Basan to outroar
    The horned herd! For I have savage cause,
    And to proclaim it civilly were like
    A halter'd neck which does the hangman thank
    For being yare about him.
  SERVANT. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
RVANT. Soundly, my lord.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Cried he? and begg'd 'a pardon?
  SERVANT. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
RVANT. He did ask favour.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. If that thy father live, let him repent
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. If that thy father live, let him repent
    Thou wast not made his daughter; and be thou sorry
    To follow Caesar in his triumph, since
    Thou hast been whipt for following him. Henceforth
    The white hand of a lady fever thee!
    Shake thou to look on't. Get thee back to Caesar;
    Tell him thy entertainment; look thou say
    He makes me angry with him; for he seems
    Proud and disdainful, harping on what I am,
    Not what he knew I was. He makes me angry;
    And at this time most easy 'tis to do't,
    When my good stars, that were my former guides,
    Have empty left their orbs and shot their fires
    Into th' abysm of hell. If he mislike
    My speech and what is done, tell him he has
    Hipparchus, my enfranched bondman, whom
    He may at pleasure whip or hang or torture,
    As he shall like, to quit me. Urge it thou.
    Hence with thy stripes, be gone.                Exit THYREUS
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Have you done yet?
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Alack, our terrene moon
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
EOPATRA. I must stay his time.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. To flatter Caesar, would you mingle eyes
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Not know me yet?
  ANTONY. 
2

TONY. Cold-hearted toward me?
  CLEOPATRA.

  ANTONY.

TONY. I am satisfied.
  CLEOPATRA.

EOPATRA. That's my brave lord!

SERVANT

  CLEOPATRA. 
2
SERVANT

EOPATRA. It is my birthday.
  ANTONY. 
2

TONY. We will yet do well.
  CLEOPATRA.

  ANTONY.

SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Do so, we'll speak to them; and to-night I'll force
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Do so, we'll speak to them; and to-night I'll force
    The wine peep through their scars. Come on, my queen,
    There's sap in't yet. The next time I do fight
    I'll make death love me; for I will contend
    Even with his pestilent scythe.     Exeunt all but ENOBARBUS

  ANTONY.

ANTONY
TONY. 'Tis well blown, lads.
  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. 'Tis well blown, lads.
    This morning, like the spirit of a youth
    That means to be of note, begins betimes.
    So, so. Come, give me that. This way. Well said.
    Fare thee well, dame, whate'er becomes of me.
    This is a soldier's kiss. Rebukeable,
    And worthy shameful check it were, to stand
    On more mechanic compliment; I'll leave thee
    Now like a man of steel. You that will fight,
    Follow me close; I'll bring you to't. Adieu.
                      Exeunt ANTONY, EROS, CAPTAINS and soldiers

  SCARUS.

  SCARUS. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
ARUS. Swallows have built
    In Cleopatra's sails their nests. The augurers
    Say they know not, they cannot tell; look grimly,
    And dare not speak their knowledge. Antony
    Is valiant and dejected; and by starts
    His fretted fortunes give him hope and fear
    Of what he has and has not.
                            [Alarum afar off, as at a sea-fight]
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. All is lost!
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. All is lost!
    This foul Egyptian hath betrayed me.
    My fleet hath yielded to the foe, and yonder
    They cast their caps up and carouse together
    Like friends long lost. Triple-turn'd whore! 'tis thou
    Hast sold me to this novice; and my heart
    Makes only wars on thee. Bid them all fly;
    For when I am reveng'd upon my charm,
    I have done all. Bid them all fly; begone.       Exit SCARUS
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Why is my lord enrag'd against his love?
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving
    And blemish Caesar's triumph. Let him take thee
    And hoist thee up to the shouting plebeians;
    Follow his chariot, like the greatest spot
    Of all thy sex; most monster-like, be shown
    For poor'st diminutives, for doits, and let
    Patient Octavia plough thy visage up
    With her prepared nails.                      Exit CLEOPATRA
  CLEOPATRA.

    Off, pluck off!
    The sevenfold shield of Ajax cannot keep
    The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
    Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
    Crack thy frail case. Apace, Eros, apace.-
    No more a soldier. Bruised pieces, go;
    You have been nobly borne.- From me awhile.        Exit EROS
  ANTONY. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
    Off, pluck off!
    The sevenfold shield of Ajax cannot keep
    The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
    Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
    Crack thy frail case. Apace, Eros, apace.-
    No more a soldier. Bruised pieces, go;
    You have been nobly borne.- From me awhile.        Exit EROS
    I will o'ertake thee, Cleopatra, and
    Weep for my pardon. So it must be, for now
    All length is torture. Since the torch is out,
    Lie down, and stray no farther. Now all labour
    Mars what it does; yea, very force entangles
    Itself with strength. Seal then, and all is done.
    Eros!- I come, my queen.- Eros!- Stay for me;
    Where souls do couch on flowers, we'll hand in hand,
    And with our sprightly port make the ghosts gaze.
    Dido and her Aeneas shall want troops,
    And all the haunt be ours.- Come, Eros, Eros!
  EROS.

SERVANT

  CLEOPATRA.

  CLEOPATRA. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
    To fool their preparation and to conquer
    Their most absurd intents.
                      Enter CHARMIAN
    Now, Charmian!
    Show me, my women, like a queen. Go fetch
    My best attires. I am again for Cydnus,
    To meet Mark Antony. Sirrah, Iras, go.
    Now, noble Charmian, we'll dispatch indeed;
    And when thou hast done this chare, I'll give thee leave
    To play till doomsday. Bring our crown and all.
                                       Exit IRAS. A noise within
  GUARDSMAN. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
ARDSMAN. Here is a rural fellow
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Let him come in.                     Exit GUARDSMAN
  CLEOPATRA. 
4
SERVANT
GUARDSMAN
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Let him come in.                     Exit GUARDSMAN
    What poor an instrument
    May do a noble deed! He brings me liberty.
    My resolution's plac'd, and I have nothing
    Of woman in me. Now from head to foot
    I am marble-constant; now the fleeting moon
    No planet is of mine.
  GUARDSMAN. 
4
SERVANT
GUARDSMAN
ANTONY
EROS
ARDSMAN. This is the man.
  CLEOPATRA.

    So sought'st to hinder.

  ANTONY. 
1
ENOBARBUS
TONY. Forbear me.                             Exit MESSENGER
    There's a great spirit gone! Thus did I desire it.
    What our contempts doth often hurl from us
    We wish it ours again; the present pleasure,
    By revolution low'ring, does become
    The opposite of itself. She's good, being gone;
    The hand could pluck her back that shov'd her on.
    I must from this enchanting queen break off.
    Ten thousand harms, more than the ills I know,
    My idleness doth hatch. How now, Enobarbus!
  ENOBARBUS. 
1
ENOBARBUS
OBARBUS. What's your pleasure, sir?
  ANTONY. 
1

  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. To let a fellow that will take rewards,
    And say 'God quit you!' be familiar with
    My playfellow, your hand, this kingly seal
    And plighter of high hearts! O that I were
    Upon the hill of Basan to outroar
    The horned herd! For I have savage cause,
    And to proclaim it civilly were like
    A halter'd neck which does the hangman thank
    For being yare about him.
  SERVANT. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
RVANT. Soundly, my lord.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Cried he? and begg'd 'a pardon?
  SERVANT. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
RVANT. He did ask favour.
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. If that thy father live, let him repent
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. If that thy father live, let him repent
    Thou wast not made his daughter; and be thou sorry
    To follow Caesar in his triumph, since
    Thou hast been whipt for following him. Henceforth
    The white hand of a lady fever thee!
    Shake thou to look on't. Get thee back to Caesar;
    Tell him thy entertainment; look thou say
    He makes me angry with him; for he seems
    Proud and disdainful, harping on what I am,
    Not what he knew I was. He makes me angry;
    And at this time most easy 'tis to do't,
    When my good stars, that were my former guides,
    Have empty left their orbs and shot their fires
    Into th' abysm of hell. If he mislike
    My speech and what is done, tell him he has
    Hipparchus, my enfranched bondman, whom
    He may at pleasure whip or hang or torture,
    As he shall like, to quit me. Urge it thou.
    Hence with thy stripes, be gone.                Exit THYREUS

ANTONY

  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. 'Tis well blown, lads.
    This morning, like the spirit of a youth
    That means to be of note, begins betimes.
    So, so. Come, give me that. This way. Well said.
    Fare thee well, dame, whate'er becomes of me.
    This is a soldier's kiss. Rebukeable,
    And worthy shameful check it were, to stand
    On more mechanic compliment; I'll leave thee
    Now like a man of steel. You that will fight,
    Follow me close; I'll bring you to't. Adieu.
                      Exeunt ANTONY, EROS, CAPTAINS and soldiers

SERVANT
LDIER. Most certain.
  ANTONY.

  CAESAR.

  AGRIPPA.

  CAESAR. 
1

  MESSENGER.

  CAESAR.

  CAESAR. 
1
SERVANT
ESAR. Go charge Agrippa
    Plant those that have revolted in the vant,
    That Antony may seem to spend his fury
    Upon himself.                       Exeunt all but ENOBARBUS
  ENOBARBUS. 
1

  SOLDIER.

  ENOBARBUS.

  AGRIPPA.

  SCARUS.

  SCARUS.

  ANTONY.

  EROS.

  SCARUS.

  SCARUS.

  CAESAR.

  ANTONY. 
1
SERVANT
TONY. Yet they are not join'd. Where yond pine does stand
  SCARUS. 
1
SERVANT
ARUS. Swallows have built
  SCARUS. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
ARUS. Swallows have built
    In Cleopatra's sails their nests. The augurers
    Say they know not, they cannot tell; look grimly,
    And dare not speak their knowledge. Antony
    Is valiant and dejected; and by starts
    His fretted fortunes give him hope and fear
    Of what he has and has not.
                            [Alarum afar off, as at a sea-fight]
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. All is lost!
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. All is lost!
    This foul Egyptian hath betrayed me.
    My fleet hath yielded to the foe, and yonder
    They cast their caps up and carouse together
    Like friends long lost. Triple-turn'd whore! 'tis thou
    Hast sold me to this novice; and my heart
    Makes only wars on thee. Bid them all fly;
    For when I am reveng'd upon my charm,
    I have done all. Bid them all fly; begone.       Exit SCARUS
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Why is my lord enrag'd against his love?
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving
    And blemish Caesar's triumph. Let him take thee
    And hoist thee up to the shouting plebeians;
    Follow his chariot, like the greatest spot
    Of all thy sex; most monster-like, be shown
    For poor'st diminutives, for doits, and let
    Patient Octavia plough thy visage up
    With her prepared nails.                      Exit CLEOPATRA
  CLEOPATRA. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
EOPATRA. Help me, my women. O, he is more mad
  CHARMIAN.

  ANTONY.

SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
  ANTONY. 
2
SERVANT
ANTONY
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
    Off, pluck off!
    The sevenfold shield of Ajax cannot keep
    The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
    Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
    Crack thy frail case. Apace, Eros, apace.-
    No more a soldier. Bruised pieces, go;
    You have been nobly borne.- From me awhile.        Exit EROS
  ANTONY. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
TONY. Unarm, Eros; the long day's task is done,
    And we must sleep. That thou depart'st hence safe
    Does pay thy labour richly. Go.                 Exit MARDIAN
    Off, pluck off!
    The sevenfold shield of Ajax cannot keep
    The battery from my heart. O, cleave, my sides!
    Heart, once be stronger than thy continent,
    Crack thy frail case. Apace, Eros, apace.-
    No more a soldier. Bruised pieces, go;
    You have been nobly borne.- From me awhile.        Exit EROS
    I will o'ertake thee, Cleopatra, and
    Weep for my pardon. So it must be, for now
    All length is torture. Since the torch is out,
    Lie down, and stray no farther. Now all labour
    Mars what it does; yea, very force entangles
    Itself with strength. Seal then, and all is done.
    Eros!- I come, my queen.- Eros!- Stay for me;
    Where souls do couch on flowers, we'll hand in hand,
    And with our sprightly port make the ghosts gaze.
    Dido and her Aeneas shall want troops,
    And all the haunt be ours.- Come, Eros, Eros!
  EROS. 
3
SERVANT

EOPATRA. He'll lead me, then, in triumph?
  DOLABELLA. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
LABELLA. Madam, he will. I know't.                [Flourish]
  CAESAR. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
ESAR. Which is the Queen of Egypt?
  DOLABELLA.

  IRAS.

  CLEOPATRA.

EOPATRA. Nay, that's certain.
  IRAS. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
AS. I'll never see't, for I am sure mine nails
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Why, that's the way
    To fool their preparation and to conquer
    Their most absurd intents.
                      Enter CHARMIAN
    Now, Charmian!
    Show me, my women, like a queen. Go fetch
    My best attires. I am again for Cydnus,
    To meet Mark Antony. Sirrah, Iras, go.
    Now, noble Charmian, we'll dispatch indeed;
    And when thou hast done this chare, I'll give thee leave
    To play till doomsday. Bring our crown and all.
                                       Exit IRAS. A noise within
  GUARDSMAN. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
ARDSMAN. Here is a rural fellow
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Let him come in.                     Exit GUARDSMAN
  CLEOPATRA. 
4
SERVANT
GUARDSMAN
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Let him come in.                     Exit GUARDSMAN
    What poor an instrument
    May do a noble deed! He brings me liberty.
    My resolution's plac'd, and I have nothing
    Of woman in me. Now from head to foot
    I am marble-constant; now the fleeting moon
    No planet is of mine.
  GUARDSMAN. 
4
SERVANT
GUARDSMAN
ANTONY
EROS
ARDSMAN. This is the man.
  CLEOPATRA. 
3
SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS
EOPATRA. Avoid, and leave him.                Exit GUARDSMAN
  CLOWN.

SERVANT
ANTONY
EROS

  CLEOPATRA.

DOLABELLA

ARMIAN. It is well done, and fitting for a princes
    Descended of so many royal kings.
    Ah, soldier!                                 [CHARMIAN dies]

CAESAR
IRAS
ANTONY
EROS
DOLABELLA
LABELLA. Caesar, thy thoughts
    Touch their effects in this. Thyself art coming
    To see perform'd the dreaded act which thou
    So sought'st to hinder.
                      [Within: 'A way there, a way for Caesar!']
  DOLABELLA.
